snippet: With the pace of delayed television viewing increasing, networks want advertisers to pay for seven days of commercial viewing to cover computer screens and tablets as well as TV sets.
abstract: Network executives are pushing for change, seeking payment for seven days of commercial viewing to cover computer screens and tablets as well as TV sets, as pace of delayed viewing is rapidly increasing; advertisers already agreed in 2007 to pay networks for commercials viewed within three days of show's first broadcast when digital video recorders were growing in popularity.
lead_paragraph: With the pace of delayed television viewing increasing, networks want advertisers to pay for seven days of commercial viewing to cover computer screens and tablets as well as TV sets.

headline.main: Seeking More Pay for Delayed Play
